result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Ruleau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation/Boat/Water Skis, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 30.68(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. (costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd M Ruleau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Loura Dah. Check forwarded to defendant 10/16/17 as we have no current address for Ms. Dah.
to Loura Dah. Check #10638.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Todd M Ruleau in court with attorney Tara L. Teesch.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Todd M Ruleau appears by phone along with attorney Tara L. Teesch who appears in person.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Teesch feels matter will resolve by next hearing, requests another status in 30 days. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
Phone appearance granted for 8/21/17 hearing.
Email from Atty Teesch requesting adjournment of 7/31/17 hearing for a few weeks to allow her to get up to speed with the case. State has no objection to adjournment. Court reschedules.
Status conference on August 21, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Todd M Ruleau appears by phone along with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Heyne feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests 30 day adjournment. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 31, 2017 at 11:15 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
State's Discovery Demand

Attorney Peter Raymond Heyne in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Citations will continue to track file. Court grants phone appearance for defendant on 6/26/17 if matter is not resolved.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2017 at 11:45 am.
Defendant's authorization for attorney to appear and act
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/25/17.
by Loura Dah

No contact direct or indirect with R.V. or his sailing vessel.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to operate a boat without valid registration and then follow all boating laws for comercial and pleasure craft.  (Defendant has already posted $500, will need to post additional $500 to be released).

Defendant Todd M Ruleau appears by video along with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Atty Heyne asks court to set balance of initial appearance until he's had a chance to see the criminal complaint. Bond set.

Defendant in custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.
$500 money order received from defendant with copies of citations and summons & complaint and note from defendant.

Defendant Todd M Ruleau not in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court review certificate of service showing defendant was served to todays court date. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
